On Thu, 22 Jul 2004, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Still, the ultimate solution is to reduce the number of tests against
> the database. :) (_JUnit Recipes_, chapter 10.)

I would say that is certainly not the "ultimate" solution, because you
can never get rid of all the tests against the database. (I interpret
"ultimate solution" as meaning that you can abandon the other technique
at some point.) At least, not without moving that test coverage
somewhere else, where it's likely to run more slowly and be harder to
test.
